name: Keila Tzoyohua
text: Came to regions on Mon the Jan 11 the 2021. At 12. I needed to add my husband to my account that I just opened a few weeks ago. He took his lunch to get this done. As we walked it there was a lady in the first bankers office space talking up a storm with a couple of men in her cubical. We were attended quickly be a nice lady with short hair and glasses that was in the front main office. We forgot my husbands passport so we had to go back home and come back. We came back and the lady in the cubical was still having a conversation with the men about things that had nothing to do with banking. We came to sit once again and wait. The lady that attended us the first time with with another couple assisting them. She finished with them and the assisted another couple that must of been here earlier and came back with a stack of paper work and she helped them quickly. We still sat here waiting. It is exactly 1:35pm and we still have not been attended and the lady in the first cubical is still working with the old men that came to just open a simple account. (I could here there conversation) even as she asked for his information which was heard very well. (There is not much sound proofing). It’s been and hour and a half, she is still with the men. When I opened my account it took the lady but 20-30 at the most to get everything done. This is ridicules!! I worked at Wells Fargo bank in Jacksonville as a teller in 2015 and we never had a banker take that long with a costumer!! That banker needs a reality check. She is short with long black hair. 😡😡😡 1:42pm and she still not done!! Seriously!!

resp.text:
Our apologies for the delay, and we're sorry to hear about your extended wait during your visit.
We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We have forwarded your concerns to the appropriate channel. -Trish

name: TaSharia
text: This is one of those loan places that you CANNOT trust. The mngr called me offering to refinance my loan. I told him straight up I don't want any money back, I was already over halfway through paying it off. He assured me that a refinance would just give me a better rate, later due date, and no money back. I thought they were doing something nice due to COVID. Once I got there he had his rep help me & it was a completely different story.  They basically redid my loan at a WAY higher interest rate & tried to dress it up. Its my fault for agreeing to it & not asking more question so please do not let them play you. Even with an early payoff it looks like I'm forced to pay 50% interest on money I didn't even need. Screw tower loan, they must be suffering if they have to pull these types of stunts.

name: Michael Frost
text: Just received a call from here. The guy on the phone would only tell me he "had a sales account with Mr. Michael" but wouldn't tell me anything else unless I confirmed my identity. Didn't say "Hey this is so and so from Tower Loan" shady shady shady.

name: Eric Price
text:
I financed a purchase through this company for $1,000. The account was set up as same as cash. Since December of 2018 I’ve paid a total of $612.21 however the balance on the website shows I still owe $484.88 when it actually should be $387.79. I called the local office yesterday and spoke with a female associate there and she could not tell me why there was such a difference in the balance. I called again this morning and spoke with Chad and he was able to tell me that my account is same as cash however it wasn’t marked as such in their system. He then put me hold to speak with  his manager and I was on hold for 30 minutes before I was hung up on. I then called back and spoke with Chad again and told him that he had me hold for 30 minutes before I was hung up on and he then transferred me to his manager who really only said what Chad told me previously and that he will give me a call back Monday to confirm that my account had been marked same as cash.
You would think that since I’ve paid my bill on time and that most of balance has been paid their customer service would be better. However their customer service is terrible. I’ve should have known better because when the account was set up initially I never received any information as far as account information and how to make payments through mail like I was told I would. I had to contact them only to find out that the account was never set up so I really could have gotten this item for free but since my integrity is solid I did what I agreed to do and took initiative to make sure the account was paid.
From the start until now my experience with Tower Loan has been piss poor and I caution all who are considering using them. If I were you I’d try a different bank with better customer service.

name: Carol Roberts
text: I miss the days when Max Credit Union was Max Federal Credit Union. Back then you couldn't get an account unless you were military or related to someone with an account. Then they became a community credit union where anyone who lived in the tri-county could join. I guess that was good for expanding the business but they are a lot more crowded now. We've been customers for almost 30 years. They still offer very good services. Their accounts are still very reasonable and they are the first placed I'd go for a car loan.

text: Up until last week I would have given 5 stars as they have always been good to me. Then they drafted money from my account to pay a relatives loan without permission from anyone. When confronted lied saying that person authorized it when they didn't. Then refused to return the money back to my account as they said they had the legal authority to do it. Which according to realitives with extensive time in banking said it could only been done if I was on the loan which I wasn't. Finally after much back and forth between the parties involved they admitted they wasn't authorized or supposed to draft that money. To which they finally reversed the transaction but didn't reverse the entire amount. They kept 2 dollars for some reason. If you get a loan here or a relative does be prepared for some shady business practices.

name: TaSharia
text: This is one of those loan places that you CANNOT trust. The mngr called me offering to refinance my loan. I told him straight up I don't want any money back, I was already over halfway through paying it off. He assured me that a refinance would just give me a better rate, later due date, and no money back. I thought they were doing something nice due to COVID. Once I got there he had his rep help me & it was a completely different story.  They basically redid my loan at a WAY higher interest rate & tried to dress it up. Its my fault for agreeing to it & not asking more question so please do not let them play you. Even with an early payoff it looks like I'm forced to pay 50% interest on money I didn't even need. Screw tower loan, they must be suffering if they have to pull these types of stunts.

name: Jan LibertyJustice
text: Myself and many people I know have had really bad experiences with this particular bank at this particular location. We have had problems with our accounts not correctly showing the right amount of money in their computers. Then when we try to talk to someone about it we are told the computer never makes mistakes. So we point out that a person has to put numbers into the computer and no person is perfect and we offer to show them our records. They agree to look at them but the manager NEVER will meet with us. No matter how many times we go ,no matter how long we wait, it goes on and on. She is always too busy to see us if the bank owes us money.  That is Regions I know so many people who are thinking of leaving or have left. I left because of this branch's  manager and Region's policies about 4 years ago and gave up and lost money when I withdrew all my money. I recently found out that a close friend of mine is going through almost the same complaint with the exact same branch manager at this Regions branch whom she's been trying to talk to for a long time!!  She's short a lot of money in her account too. The assistant manager seemed very nice and wanted to help but he says only the branch manager has the power to handle such matters and he would tell me when to come to see her. But she wouldn't see me even after many months of coming in to see her!! I tried to complain to Regions Bank but I was told the decision must be made by the branch manager where I opened my account. If Possible I would give this branch and Regions Bank 0 Stars.

name: Sierra King
text: Haven’t ever had to deal with the pell city branch, I usually contact leeds or the one on 280 and they provide EXCEPTIONAL service and try and rectify all issues. The pell city location is awful. The assistant manager is horrifically rude. I called about THREE overdraft fees coming out of my account for ONE thing that overdrafted overnight before I got a chance to deposit cash. I called to find out why it took 3 out, totaling over $100. As soon as I said I had a question her response was “well I don’t understand what you want me to do I can see the same things as you can”. She continued to tell me my banking app was incorrect and I did not have money in my account and multiple pending transactions that “I could see” I have NEVER had issues seeing pending transactions or even with the money not coming out of my bank immediately for a “pending” transaction. She then told me the only accurate way to monitor how much money I have is to keep an “old fashioned check book”. I asked her again why I got charged THREE overdraft fees and she went through my account telling me all of the charges that still wouldn’t have led to me having three overdraft charges. She put me on hold 3 times in the middle of me talking and concluded the conversation by telling me she could only take one off, which I still haven’t seen the money back in my account, and that I would have to wait until her branch manager got back on Monday to resolve the issue and see if he could do anything for me at all, and that she would tell him I was “so distraught over the situation” in a super condescending tone. Absolutely disgraceful to handle business in this way in the middle of a pandemic where so many people are financially stretched. I wasn’t even fighting the first $36 charge, but the other two were absurd. Would not recommend this location, and it’s seriously making me reconsider banking with regions all together if this is how business will be conducted. I have been with them for 4 years and can understand mistakes when handled KINDLY and appropriately.

resp.text: Our apologies for the delay and your customer service experience. We appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns with us. We have forwarded your concerns to the appropriate channel. If you'd like to further discuss,  feel free to email us at askRegions@regions.com. -Trish

name: Hannah Gulledge
text: Drive through is ridiculous.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this and for any extended wait time you may have experienced. We've made sure to pass it along to the appropriate channels. -Trish

name: Sandar Johnson
text: Cards constantly declining when I have the available balance to cover it, the chips constantly reads wrong so I have to swipe which defeats the purpose of a chip. Checks bounce when they shouldn't then theres the fact that regions is the most fee happy bank I've ever dealt with. Dont over draft by .10 cents I did one time and they charge me 36 bucks......make sure when u pay ur credit card that u leave the money in there cause I took out money and my account was 2 dollars shortstop my card payment was returned.....which they charged me 36 bucks for.....its crazy. I hate how this is the only majornon local bank here in pell city. We deserve better options only leaving 3 stars instead of 2 cause the ATM is super fancy, can cash/deposit checks, and deposit cash. Super nice ATM, When it works, just tried this mo re ning and it gave me a depositing error.

name: Kandace Ballard
text:
I lost my Regions debit card about 4 days ago; after looking everywhere, I finally gave in to reporting it as lost/stolen. The website read that I'd receive it within 5-7 business days, which I was okay with, but my biggest concern was when I read that it was being mailed to an old address I had connected to the card; which is a very, VERY bad neighborhood. So around 11pm I called customer service, and they were able to cancel the request (thank God,) and stated I needed to go to my local Regions branch to change the address and request new, so I did.

The wait was a little longer than expected, but I'm not one to complain. I typically do not leave reviews, but the woman who assisted me, Roxie Kitchen, was phenomenal and deserves the recognition! She not only helped me update my address and request me a new card, but she also assisted me with setting up a savings account, and gave me several options to help me build up my credit score, since I am looking to purchase my (first) own vehicle by the end of the year and I currently have no credit.

We had some complications, but despite it all she kept a positive attitude and was very helpful, informative and sweet; it was just like talking to a friend. She welcomed every question I had and was able to give me a clear answer and explain in detail what everything was.

If you live in Troy, or just passing by in need of a visit, definitely stop by and talk to Mrs. Roxie. It was a great experience!

name: John Calvin
text:
Worst banking experience due to management.

I went to this particular Regions bank today simply to pay a bill.  When i got there cars were lined up by about 5-7 in each row so i decided to go inside. It took more than 30 minutes to get to the front to pay my bill.  They literally had one inside teller, and one outside teller, on Labor day weekend.   As i moved up the line i looked back and saw that the line stretched to the outside door and customers were getting impatient.  I assume this is the way the outside car lines were as well.

I can understand it being a busy day due to circumstances.  I can't understand they only having 2 total tellers (1 inside, and one outside teller) on a day such as this, other than poor management.

This was wrong for both the employees (whom i feel sorry for), and the customers.

At other Regions bank locations i have had a good experience.  This one i would rather never go back.

text: I went to the one that replaced this one off Lakeshore (this one is closed down). But to make my point, I was very disappointed in the service. She only tried one time and kinda gave me a negative attitude towards it when I asked if I could try another Regions bank. So I went to the other Regions bank on Oxmoor and I had no issues there. Service was fast and easy!! Had no problems doing my transaction! Regions bank off Lakeshore disappointed me today.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Tamera. Having the ability to do all your banking needs in one location should be expected. We will escalate your concern properly to improve our service. To discuss other questions please email us at askRegions@regions.com and our team will be glad to connect with you. – Hector

name: Regan Y.
text:
This is the best regions in the city. They are so friendly, remember me when I come in, and have wonderful customer service.

I know times are crazy right now, and sometimes things take longer than normal - but they are super apologetic and get you in and out as fast as they can.

name: Amanda Saenz
text: This is the slowest bank I have ever been too.  My employer banks here and we have to make commercial deposits.  We stopped going to this location and went to the other lakeshore branch due to sometimes being there 45 minutes getting the deposits done.  Unfortunately for some insane reason Regions closed the other Lakeshore branch and we are back to having to go to this one now.  Today we go to make 7 deposits we get up to the tube and are told to drive to lane that is closed and wait while they do the deposits.  Keep in mind you still can’t go into the building so drive thru is our only option to taking care of our business.  While waiting for the deposits to get done 7 cars went thru and got taken care of.  Then they tell me over the speaker to get back into an open lane and wait behind the 3 cars to receive my receipts and money bag.  I couldn’t get from the lane I was parked in that they told me to go to because that one is broke.  I made them bring it to me out front because I was waiting in the line.  I have contacted my corporate office and we are in the process of changing banks now because this is not how you treat customers.  I shouldn’t of been made to go through hoops to give you our businesses money!

I only gave one star because there is nothing lower.
Not sure who the lady was running the drive thru but it was only 9:30 am and apparently she was already in a bad mood. My office manager had asked me to drop off the credit card payments for her since this option is no longer available to do online any longer. I pulled into the drive thru no one in front of me, know one behind and hand her the payments. She quickly snaps at me that there is a 3 transaction maximum in the drive thru. I tell her I didn't know and with attitude she says "It's right there on the sign".  Next she complains because the office had not torn off the check stubs as she puts all but 3 of the payments back in the drawer for me to get. I asked her what she was doing and she said we have a 3 transaction limit. I look in my mirror and still I'm the only person in the drive thru. I told her to just give me those 3 back and I would go to another branch which I did. The Regions in downtown Birmingham on 3rd Ave S knows how to treat customers. I will never go back to the Odum Road location and will be switching all my company visa's to another bank.

name: Arthur Lamounier Moura
text:
The staff was really helpful and attentive, and tried to solve my situation and provide me the information I needed. However, if you're an international student, they do not allow you to open the simplest account without having a Social Security Number with you. This is very odd, considering that all the other banks in town accept the regular immigrant documents, such as visa, I-20, passport, etc. Also, Auburn University is an institution that receives lots of International students for all over the world every semester and this Credit union did not think of a good solution for this type of customer...

Since I had to open an account in one way or another, I had to choose another bank, in my case Chase Bank... So be aware of that if you're an international student!

resp.text:
Mr. Moura,

AU Credit Union accepts one or more of the following documents for a non-U.S. person:
- Taxpayer Identification Number
- Passport Number and Country of Issuance
- Alien Identification Card Number
- Number and Country of Issuance of any other Government-Issued Document evidencing nationality or residence and bearing a photograph or similar safeguard

We sincerely apologize if one or more of the above mentioned documents were provided to us but denied at the time of your account opening. Please still consider AU Credit Union as a trusted financial institution in your local area, and contact memberservices@aufcu.org about reapplying for membership with one or more of the documents listed above.

name: Jon marsh
text: I started a small business and I make glass globe plant life. So the last few payments have been by check (which is fine)  I never experienced the type of rudeness I received like I did the other day from a teller. I've been cashing the checks through my wells Fargo account mostly and others I have cashed inside the bank I received the check from, to see if I want another account with another bank. (Walking in regions) waited 10 mins to even see a teller due to them being busy(3 customers 2 tellers) yeah that was sarcasm.  When it was finally my turn I told the cashier I need to cash this check. She responded ok I need your LICENSE  to which I provided while I signed the back of the check. Of forgot to mention this is a $25.oo check. She asked if I had an account with regions I responded no mam. She said you are aware their is a service fee on checks if you do not have an account with regions. I said no I didn't know that, that's weird. I said how much, she replied 2 dollars (not much it seems but when you struggle to make ends meet that $2 means a lot) she said yes it's just our policy " EVERYONE GETS CHARGED THE FEE IF YOU ARE NOT AN ACCOUNT HOLDER" I said ok, my bank doesn't do that. When I write a check to someone they cash without having an account with my bank it bc that's their hard earned money. She responded "well the only way I cannot charge you is if the check HOLDER gives permission to WAIVE the fee. So naturally I was pissed off. I said how is it you can say that it's a mandatory fee and EVERONE GETS CHARGED THAT FEE IF NOT AN ACCOUNT HOLDER, but if the check HOLDER called and said it's ok to WAIVE the fee. That literally makes no sense! She replied in a smart tone "well why don't you just deposit it to your wells account. I said I'm almost out of gas and just figured I could cash it here being less than a mile from my house. I said fine just cash it I'm on my way to work. I will be visiting the branch manager of regional manager tomorrow to see exactly why they say it's mandatory but it can be waived? I'm in customer service I know what it's like dealing with the public but that was uncalled for rudeness. I will recommend everyone close their account bc my friend did the day I told her what happened she said she had no idea they did this when she paid ppl by check and was outraged. So that's 1 account being closed. 1 may not matter much to this bank but I have only told her so far so next is other friends who msg me about their accounts with them.

In a few dealings we’ve even been offered a slightly lower rate elsewhere, but we know they don’t compare to the service we always receive from Patricia. Kudos to Patricia and kudos to Family Security Credit Union for keeping the hometown feel in a world that’s becoming less customer friendly everyday. Keep up the outstanding work!

name: Peter Zahel
text: My son deposited his first paycheck to his Regions account on Friday. According to teller the check should be cleared by Saturday. Since my son didnt see any deposit on his account by Monday morning we have contacted the bank with an inquiry. Regions told us they (teller) deposited the check check to a wrong account. It is Wednesday afternoon and my son still doesn't have his money. Regions bank refusing to credit his account immediately until they will resolve the situation internally. Shame on them and shame on such a business practice. If we would make an error our account would be charged with monumental fees. Regions bank pretty much stole my son's money and gave it to someone else. Still waiting for resolution. We have the deposit ticket from the bank in hands..... Sounds like a material for an attorney to look at. DON'T BANK WITH REGIONS.

name: Don Baker
text: Didn't have any activity in my business account for a bit, and Regions closed it without notifying me.  My customers were depositing payments to this account.  Now I have to try and explain this to my customers, and find another bank.

name: Grey Peterson
text: They should have a sign on the door "If you are in a hurry then don't come inside". First time experience at this location. There were several cars in drive thru so I thought it would be quicker to go in (I only had one deposit to make). Parking lot was full but got lucky with one space. Walked in and three people sitting in chairs right inside door, all employees busy with customers, two empty computers with no employees. I really didn't  know what to do when I walked in. I asked the customers sitting if they were waiting for a teller and they said yes so I noted who was in front of me and stood and waited. One customer got frustrated and left so now two in front of me. Two more came in and walked ahead of us and I kindly said that we were waiting for a teller, too. They were nice, one left and the other sat down and waited. The two in front of me were there because they had wrongful credits to their account so they would be a while, too. They all said that the wait was common at this location. I stood there for 20 minutes before I finally got waited on.  The teller was nice and started to chat with me ( I was in a hurry, on my lunch and frustrated) and there was was still one person behind me. I told him that I was in a hurry and had already waited 20 minutes to please just deposit my check.  He then tried to tell me that I could have used the machine outside and or gone through the drive thru (he was still very nice). I was not. I told him I thought it would be quicker to come inside that I had never waited this long with just 2 people ahead of me.  He said that he thought it was normal to wait at all banks.  He stayed professional but I know I made him mad at the end because his smile went away. It wasn't his fault. Evidently they have a new policy that you can go to any teller for anything, opening an account, lost card, wrongful credits to your account, all of which take a long time so if you want to cash a check or make a simple deposit then don't go inside. I did hear that the drive thru is pretty quick even with a line.

text:
I’ve banked with Regions for well over a decade in MO and this branch is a joke! Unorganized, unhelpful and incompetent.
Went in to get a proof of funds for a home purchase, the woman said she would email it to me. Never received it. Called back and the woman on the phone assured me it was being emailed by closing yesterday.
Had to go back this morning and it still hadn’t been taken care of. I sat and waited until Rhonda could get a one sentence letter completed.
If I need anything else, I’ll call my MO branch and have them take care of it. Very disappointing level of service from beginning to end.

text: A vehicle was left at my property a month ago. I found the papers with the loan agreement and called to see if they were looking for said vehicle. I waited almost 3 weeks before calling again, at this time I was told they had to talk with someone to see if they wanted the vehicle. When I called back two weeks later, because I was told someone would call me back, I was told they didnt want the car. I proceeded to  get said vehicle off my property  when I was told I had to get a WRITTEN letter stating they didnt want the car before I could proceed with getting car off my property.  My husband went to the office and they REFUSED to give him any documentation.  They did call the other party but was told again they needed WRITTEN documentation before PROCEEDING AGAIN THEY REFUSED..IM VERY FRUSTRATED AND AM VERY CONCERNED THAT THEY WERENT WILLING TO GO ABOVE AND BEYOND TO SATISFY A CUSTOMER. I Intend to go where I need to go in the company to get this resolved. VERY VERY UNSATISFIED CUSTOMER.

resp.text: Cassandra - please contact the corporate office at 864-515-5600 and ask for Stephanie Wade.

These people despite me telling them repeatedly to call after lunch(I work 4pm to midnight), would always call and wake me up at 8-9 in the morning. Needless to say, I left that branch with a bitter taste in my mouth. There is absolutely NO EXCUSE for having only one line at lunch time. There should've been at least two windows open.

I will give it one more chance, but if I have to wait 30 minutes again, I will NO LONGER do business at this branch.

I shamefully did this before a few years ago and they just asked me my personal Information and made me sign a paper so that way I could get cash taken out. I told her I would go to the other regions where someone would be nice enough to help me. I went to the regions on hill crest and she was the exact opposite of the lady I talked to at this bank. I was able to get money out after telling her all of my personal info.

I understand it's to be safe but when someone knows all of their information by heart and can even pull up their account on their phone and tell them how much is in their account, I feel like there needs to be exceptions. Bad customer service.

text: Horrible!!’ My mom had a saving account and checking she put me and My brothers on the account as beneficiaries they did not explained to her that it wasn’t like if she’ll die the next person in line will be over it so they have to write a check separate between all of us which it’s not a problem but when I explained one of the brothers is in prison for 15 years they told me he has to be there to get his cut but we all have to be there to sign off on it I was so upset we need that money to pay for my mother bills I’m so upset that’s her money not there’s so we have to get a lawyer I will not recommend anyone to get an account there 3 years ago my uncle died he had a account there he died shortly when he got the account he had no one over is account he had 8000 in his checking he had no burial insurance my mother and my aunt talked to them about it they told them to bring a death certificate they will work something out well my aunt and mother did they copied it and told them there was nothing they can do so my mom and aunt had to take money out of there pockets to bury their brother my mom had his statements they took every bit of his money out of his account that’s horrible please go to another bank they have no compassion for their consumers
